string-array.name: angkorwat_hints
string-array.item: It is largest religious monument in the world
It was a Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu, but later became Buddhist Temple
It was built by Khmer King Suryavarman II
It was built on early 12th century at Yasodharapura, capital of Khmer Empire
This temple designed to represent Mount Meru, home of Devas
It’s original name was Vrah Viṣṇuloka
In Khmer it name means Temple City
Total temple area is 1,626,000 sq.m
This temple is symbol of Cambodia, appearing in its National Flag

string-array.name: colosseum_hints
string-array.item: It is the largest Amphitheatre ever built.
Its construction began under the emperor Vespasian in AD 72 and was completed in AD 80 under emperor Titus.
Made from stone and concrete, this magnificent monument was built with the man power of tens of thousands of slaves
It could hold between 50,000 and 80,000 spectators
Its original name was Amphitheatrum Flavium
It is used to stage gladiatorial games, animal hunts and mock sea battles
It is elliptical in plan and is 189 meters long, and 156 meters wide, with a base area of 24,000 sq. m
It was featured in the 2010 video game Assassin's Creed: Brotherhood
It is a great tourist attraction in the centre of Rome, Italy

string-array.name: greatwall_hints
string-array.item: Its original purpose was to defend against incursions by northern nomadic tribes
It was built by more than 20 dynasties for 2,500 years from 7th century BC to 19th century AD
Total length of this wall is 21,196.18 km
The building materials of the walls included the rammed earth, bricks, stones and rocks and glutinous rice flour
More than 1,000,000 laborers were recruited for the construction of this huge monument
It attracts 50 million visitors every year
Most famous part of the wall is built in 220–206 BC by Qin Shi Huang, the first Emperor of China
The majority of the existing wall is from the Ming Dynasty (1368–1644)
Its chinese name Wanli Changcheng Ten-Thousand Mile Long Wall

string-array.name: leaning_tower_hints
string-array.item: It took 200 years to build this Bell Tower which might have saved the building from Toppling
Its Construction started in August 14, 1173 designed by Bonanno Pisano
Tommaso di Andrea Pisano completed its construction in 1372
Today this Tower leans at about 3.99 degrees
Its maximum tilt was 5.5 degrees
Galileo Galilei may dropped two cannonballs of different masses from the tower to demonstrate that their speed of descent was independent of their mass
After recent restoration this tower is expected to be stable for next 200 years
There are other leaning tower. But it is most famous
The tower is situated behind the Pisa Cathedral and is the third oldest structure in the Pisa, Piazza del Duomo

string-array.name: machupicchu_hints
string-array.item: In the Quechua Indian language, Its name means Old Peak or Old Mountain
This monument built on Mountain without help of wheels
It has a sacred Intihuatana stone accurately indicates the two equinoxes. Twice a year, the sun sits directly over the stone creating no shadow
It was built around 1450–1460 by King Pachacutec Inca Yupanqui
It was only used for approximately 80 years before most of its inhabitants died from smallpox
It is in Andes Mountain in Peru
In 1911 American historian and explorer Hiram Bingham found it by accident
It is most visited tourist attraction of Peru
It is best preserved Inca Royal city

string-array.name: petra_hints
string-array.item: In Greek its name means Rock
It is also called Al-Batrā in Arabic
Constructed around 4th century BCE as the capital of the Nabataean Kingdom
it was rediscovered in 1812 by Johann Ludwig Burckhardt
To enter this city, one has to pass through a narrow canyon of about 1 km. It is bound by tall cliffs called Al-Siq up to 80 km
This city featured in many Hollywood films like Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade, Arabian Nights
Another name for this city is the Rose City due to the color of the stone out of which it is carved
Al Khazneh or the Treasury is its most famous ruin
A revolt of Arabs in was led by Lawrence of Arabia against the Ottoman regime is started here

string-array.name: pyramidsofgiza_hints
string-array.item: These are the biggest tomb ever build for Kings
They were the tallest man-made structure in the world for more than 3,800 years
It is by far the oldest of the ancient Wonders and the only one still in existence
It is situated at outskirt of Cairo, Capital of Egypt
Biggest of three was built in 2560–2540 BC as tomb of pharaoh Khufu
Other Two are tomb of pharaoh Khafre and Menkaure
It is claimed that they are precisely aligned with the Constellation of Orion
As per Greek historian Herodotus this tombs had taken 400,000 men 20 years to build, working in three-month shifts 100,000 men at a time
This are the Symbol of Egypt for thousands of year

string-array.name: tajmahal_hints
string-array.item: It is known as greatest monument of love
Rabindranath Tagore described it as 'a tear on the face of eternity'
Every day 12,000 visitor come visit this monument
Persian architect Ustad Ahmad Lahori said to be chief architect of this building
It was commissioned in 1632 and completed in 1653
It’s building material is white marble inlaid with semi-precious stones
Its building cost estimated at the time to be around 32 million rupees. Current approximate value will be 52.8 billion rupees
It is situated in the bank of river Yamuna in the city of Agra
It was commissioned by Shah Jahan to be built in the memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal

string-array.name: teotihuacan_hints
string-array.item: Name this city in Aztec means birthplace of the gods
It was the largest urban center of Mesoamerica housed a population of 150,000 people
The city is thought to have been established around 100 BC
It is the most visited archaeological site in Mexico
It is situated approximately 40 kilometres northeast of Mexico City
Largest building of this city is the Pyramid of the Sun
The original name and builder of the city is unknown
During Aztec times, the city was a place of pilgrimage and identified with the myth of Tollan, the place where the sun was created
The city's broad central avenue, called Avenue of the Dead

string-array.name: tigernest_hints
string-array.item: It is also known as the Taktsang Palphug Monastery
It is build around a cave where Guru Padmasambhava is said to have meditated for three years, three months, three weeks, three days and three hours in the 8th century
It is built in 1692 by Gyalse Tenzin Rabgye
It hangs on a precarious cliff at 900 metres above the Paro valley
The monks who practice Vajrayana Buddhism at this cave monastery live here for three years and seldom go down to the Paro valley
This monastery buildings consist of four main temples and residential shelters
In 2015, the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, Prince William and Kate Middleton made the trek to the monastery while visiting Bhutan
In 2005 this Monastery is rebuild after destroyed by fire in 1998
It has become cultural Icon of Bhutan
